attributes.action: Equal Parenting: Advocating for 50/50 Custody for Both Parents
attributes.additional_details:
It is in the Childs best interest to obtain a meaningful relationship with both parents.  

Currently, there is an incentive for one parent to unfairly restrict access based on a higher award granted via the CMA.  

In unresolved cases, the outcome of child arrangements is dictated by the parent willing to cause the most distress to the child; thereafter the only option the opposing parent has is to either cause more distress or fund mediation and a legal battle most people cannot afford.
attributes.background:
Legal reform is required in order to grant both parents shared and equal (50/50) custody.

Family law dictates a child has the right for a meaningful relationship with both parents.  However, the dynamic of this relationship is not automatically equitable.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action: 

Give parents who split up automatic 50/50 shared care of their children
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/704218
